page.title: 06Ash Manor.
page.content: Ash Manor dates back to the original Domesday Book. The building which stands today dates from Elizabethan times although some of the original foundations still stand today. It is possible that monks from St. Peter's Church lived there for some time although the manor was not a monastery. Later the local squire would have lived there. The manor is now owned by Mr and Mrs Smith who have lived there for 6 years. Surrounding this beautiful beamed building is the original moat. It is about 3 metres wide and 2 metres deep. Beside the moat grows a yew tree which is believed to be about 500 years old. There is a theory that one of the fields belonging to the manor might have been the village green and could have been the origin of the name Ash Green which is the name of the area.
